intro: Agialid cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf marsh grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is native to wetland and marsh environments, where it thrives in saturated soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like blades that are typically narrow and pointed. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Agialid cuneifolia plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for wetland wildlife.
